planet.description: The star HR 8799 is a young star in the constellation of Pegasus. It hostst a debri disk and at least 3 planets. The objects are near the upper limit for being planets. Objects are classified as brown dwarfs if they are capable of deuterium fusion (above 13 Jupiter masses).
planet.imagedescription: This image shows three planets orbiting the star HR 8799. It was optained with the Keck II telescope on Hawaii. Credit: C. Marois et al., NRC Canada.
